channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Iowa floodwaters breach levees as even more rain dumps onto parts of the Midwest
item.description: A vast swath of the Midwest has been under siege from torrential rains while also being hit with a heat wave. Hundreds of people were rescued, homes were damaged, and at least two people have died.
item.content:encoded:
A vast swath of the Midwest has been under siege from torrential rains while also being hit with a heat wave. Hundreds of people were rescued, homes were damaged, and at least two people have died.

(Image credit: Nick Rohlman/The Gazette)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange pleads guilty
item.description: Assange pleaded guilty to a felony charge of violating the Espionage Act. His court hearing was held in Saipan, in the Northern Mariana Islands, a U.S. commonwealth.
item.content:encoded:
Assange pleaded guilty to a felony charge of violating the Espionage Act. His court hearing was held in Saipan, in the Northern Mariana Islands, a U.S. commonwealth.

(Image credit: Chung Sung-Jun)
item.dc:creator: Naina Rao

item.title: Republican lawmakers in Connecticut fight a future ban on gas-powered vehicles
item.description: The small faction of Republicans in the Democratic-dominated Connecticut legislature managed to lead the state out of its commitment to phase out sales of gas-powered cars.
item.content:encoded: The small faction of Republicans in the Democratic-dominated Connecticut legislature managed to lead the state out of its commitment to phase out sales of gas-powered cars.
item.dc:creator: Molly Ingram

item.title: The NTSB holds its final meeting on the 2023 Ohio train derailment
item.description: The National Transportation Safety Board returns to East Palestine Ohio to hold its final board meeting on last year's fiery derailment of a Norfolk-Southern train.
item.content:encoded: The National Transportation Safety Board returns to East Palestine Ohio to hold its final board meeting on last year's fiery derailment of a Norfolk-Southern train.
item.dc:creator: Julie Grant

item.title: Inflation has driven expenses up for charity groups — while driving donations down
item.description: Charitable giving picked up last year after falling in 2022. But inflation is chipping away at the value of gifts, putting a squeeze on donors and non-profits alike.
item.content:encoded: Charitable giving picked up last year after falling in 2022. But inflation is chipping away at the value of gifts, putting a squeeze on donors and non-profits alike.
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: This Arizona nonprofit helps get informal caregivers everything they need for the job
item.description: To shore up childcare in Arizona, a nonprofit has long focused on training informal caregivers -- the family, friends and neighbors who care for a majority of young children in the state.
item.content:encoded: To shore up childcare in Arizona, a nonprofit has long focused on training informal caregivers -- the family, friends and neighbors who care for a majority of young children in the state.
item.dc:creator: Andrea Hsu

item.title: An insider’s look at how Biden preps for a debate
item.description: NPR'S Juana Summers speaks with Bob Bauer, the personal lawyer to President Biden, who stood in for Trump and Bernie Sanders in 2020 during mock-debates for the president to prep.
item.content:encoded: NPR'S Juana Summers speaks with Bob Bauer, the personal lawyer to President Biden, who stood in for Trump and Bernie Sanders in 2020 during mock-debates for the president to prep.
item.dc:creator: Megan Lim

item.title: New research looks at how political misinformation is targeted at Latinos
item.description: A new poll from asked Latinos about misinformation and elections. It comes as efforts are underway to combat false narratives targeting Latinos.
item.content:encoded: A new poll from asked Latinos about misinformation and elections. It comes as efforts are underway to combat false narratives targeting Latinos.
item.dc:creator: Jude Joffe-Block

item.title: Israel let some wounded children leave Gaza for treatment, leaving thousands behind
item.description: For the first time in almost two months, Israel has allowed a small group of kids to leave Gaza for medical treatment. Aid groups say the move came after U.S. pressure and a court challenge in Israel.
item.content:encoded: For the first time in almost two months, Israel has allowed a small group of kids to leave Gaza for medical treatment. Aid groups say the move came after U.S. pressure and a court challenge in Israel.
item.dc:creator: Jane Arraf

item.title: Underground tours resume at Minnesota's oldest iron mine
item.description: History buffs and tourists get a chance to go 2,300 feet underground to visit a historic mine in Minnesota.
item.content:encoded: History buffs and tourists get a chance to go 2,300 feet underground to visit a historic mine in Minnesota.
item.dc:creator: Daniel Kraker
